reviews.productTitle: Leviton 5627-W 20 Amp, 120/277 Volt, Decora Single-Pole / Single-Pole AC Combination Switch, Commercial Grade, Grounding, White
reviews.text: I purchased this switch to replace a faulty one controlling my Panasonic FV-0811VF1 WhisperWarm DC Ventilation Fan/Heater in the bathroom. Despite not being an electrician or a particularly skilled DIYer, I found the installation to be quite straightforward. The terminals on the back of the switch were clearly marked and conveniently matched the wiring of the original, broken switch. It was a simple matter of connecting the wires color to color, and I had the new switch installed within minutes. The switch itself has a firm but not overly stiff feel when toggling it on or off. It feels more substantial than a standard light switch, which gives me confidence in its ability to handle the load of the quiet yet powerful fan and the heater in my Panasonic unit. The standard white color blends seamlessly with the other switches in my bathroom. Given its low price point, the fact that it's rated for the necessary amperage of my Panasonic WhisperWarm fan/heater combo, and that it's UL listed for safety, I'm very pleased with this purchase. It seems durable after a month of use and effectively controls my bathroom fan and heater without any issues. If you need a reliable and easy-to-install switch for a similar application, especially for a unit like the Panasonic WhisperWarm, this is a great option.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2025
reviews.title: Reliable Switch for High-Amp Bathroom Fan/Heater Combo

reviews.text: The screws on these "commercial" duty switches have become garbage. The heads strip out easily even when using the correct tools. I am a commercial retired electrician and Leviton is cheaping out. I can only imagine that the inside is also cheap and not what it used to be.

reviews.title: Screws are Junk

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 5627-W 20 Amp, 120/277 Volt, Decora Single-Pole / Single-Pole AC Combination Switch, Commercial Grade, Grounding, White
reviews.text: The center of the switch has a rocker tap inside that is held in place by that thin section of plastic that runs across the center of the two switches. That snapped within 2 weeks of use leaving the power engaged on 1 switch. Very poor design with weak plastic as a center support for the two switches. They need to make a better and stronger support in the center for the rocker tabs. I emailed Leviton and they could care less. Stay away from this switch, it can be very dangerous
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
reviews.title: Broken within 2 weeks

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 5627-W 20 Amp, 120/277 Volt, Decora Single-Pole / Single-Pole AC Combination Switch, Commercial Grade, Grounding, White
reviews.text: I wanted to hardwire some undercabinet lighting in the kitchen, but had a single rocker switch for a light over the kitchen sink and I didn't want to lose the sink light or have both on the same switch. I found Legrand (RCD11WCC6) and Leviton (5627) dual switches to replace single rocker switches. The Legrand rocks up and down, while the Leviton rocks side to side so I used the Leviton for the kitchen application since it is next to an outlet, and the Legrand in the living room because we added a ceiling fan and had to convert two single rocker switches to a single and a double, and the Legrand allowed all three switches to rock in the same direction. Very pleased with the outcome of both.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2022
reviews.title: Let me use the sink light and under cabinet lights independently

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 5627-W 20 Amp, 120/277 Volt, Decora Single-Pole / Single-Pole AC Combination Switch, Commercial Grade, Grounding, White
reviews.text: When we moved into our new condo, the bathroom lights and fan were wired within 1 switch. Pretty inconvenient if the fan in each bathroom needed to be left on for a longer time to remove condensation or possibly odors. Isnâ€™t that what the purpose of the fan is for? And why have the lights on for that extended time? This switch allowed splitting the lights and the fan each onto their own switch, without having to increase the box size and add a second individual switch.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
reviews.title: Worked perfectly to split 1 switch into 2.
